item.title: Road repairs after flood delayed by 'excruciating' eligibility criteria
item.description: Victorian councils say they are required to provide before-and-after photos of every 100 metres of road in order to be eligible for flood recovery funding.

item.title: ANZ faces record $240m penalty for ripping off customers and government
item.description: ANZ bank has agreed to a record penalty with the corporate regulator over its dealings with about 65,000 customers, as well as the federal government.

item.title: Inquest hears prison system failed Aboriginal inmate before he died
item.description: A coronial inquest hears the system failed First Nations prisoner Clinton Austin before his death.

item.title: How is Australia affected by climate change? The National Climate Risk Assessment models the future
item.description: For the first time, the government has modelled the threats from climate change on Australia's future. What's the point of a document like this, and can it help us avoid the worst-case scenarios?

item.title: A comment shared at a recent anti-immigration rally was met by cheers.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Future of Bendigo Writers Festival unclear amid calls for transparent review
item.description: A councillor is demanding answers from his own executive over the botched Bendigo Writers Festival, asking colleagues whether they want to be remembered as the council that "killed" it.

item.title: Nikki Webster sings with her children for 25th anniversary of Sydney Olympics
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Shire of Coolgardie awaits decision on future after giving evidence to minister
item.description: The embattled Shire of Coolgardie waits to hear whether it will be suspended ahead of local government elections over concerns about financial and managerial mismanagement.

item.title: Australia Diamonds announce netball squads for Test series against New Zealand, South Africa
item.description: Goal-shooter Lucy Austin is a shock selection in the Australian netball squad to face South Africa, winning a place after initially being included as an "invitee" to their training camp.

item.title: SA's ongoing harmful algal bloom labelled 'cultural emergency' by First Nations groups
item.description: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

item.title: Why 'everything feels easier' for Chloe Rykers since her breast reduction
item.description: Chloe Rykers says her "big boobs" had, in various ways, made her career harder and left her feeling uncomfortable and in pain.

item.title: GIM Trading director Darren Geddes blocked from leaving Australia in court order
item.description: After the ABC revealed GIM Trading had raised millions from customers who later suspected fraudulent activity, a judge has prohibited the current director from leaving the country.

item.title: Jimmy Barnes, Dave Faulkner among music industry voices in open letter urging ANU to keep School of Music
item.description: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

item.title: Does the damning planning report mean the end for Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium?
item.description: The Tasmanian Planning Commission described the Hobart stadium as a "singular, large, bulky monolith" with "optimism bias" in the government's cost-benefit figures. What does this mean for the stadium?

item.title: Albanese has found out nailing down Pacific agreements is harder than expected
item.description: Anthony Albanese was meant to emerge from his recent flurry of Pacific diplomacy holding no fewer than two major agreements — instead he's returning home conspicuously empty-handed.

item.title: Perth council City of Bayswater loses legal bid to stop pet cats roaming
item.description: The WA parliament has intervened to stop a Perth council from bringing in fines for people who allow their cats to leave their properties.

item.title: Gout Gout finishes third in 200m heat
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man claims council bid to remove 'therapy' roosters is contrary to human rights conventions
item.description: A South Australian council has taken a disability pensioner to court to remove his allegedly noisy roosters, but he has argued the council's application should not proceed because it is discriminatory and the birds are his "therapeutic" animals.

item.title: Gaming history goes on display with Australian titles Hollow Knight Silksong and Team Fortress chronicled
item.description: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

item.title: Australia loses second ODI to India by record runs margin ahead of Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: A 102-run thumping, the biggest loss by runs for Australia's women's team, sets up a thrilling ODI series decider in India ahead of the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: How youth orchestras foster lifelong friendships and open career pathways for musicians
item.description: With youth orchestras set to busk on the streets of Sydney and Melbourne this weekend, Australian musicians share how those orchestras helped shape their careers.

item.title: Australian cow market at record high as US demand hits 'scary times'
item.description: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

item.title: PNG's much-wanted NRL team has had setbacks. Experts say history is on its side
item.description: Observers say Papua New Guinea's decades-long history of rugby league success and passion is on its side as it prepares for the next sporting leap into the NRL.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate targets on path to net zero judged by the experts
item.description: After much anticipation, Australia has its new climate targets. Now that the dice have fallen, we consult experts on their assessment of how these targets stack up with what’s at stake.

item.title: Albanese to meet with Trump after returning from Pacific empty-handed
item.description: This week in politics, the prime minister returned home from the Pacific empty-handed and the climate debate continued to unsettle the Coalition.

item.title: National Gathering backs plans for new First Nations body, but tensions remain
item.description: First Nations leaders have endorsed plans for a new national representative body to be established. Here’s what we know.

item.title: Bindi Magic art exhibition opens in Alice Springs as organisation celebrates 25 years
item.description: For 25 years Bindi Mwerre Anthurre Artists has been helping people with a disability to communicate through creativity.

item.title: Police officer found not guilty of assault during shopping centre scuffle at Batemans Bay
item.description: A New South Wales police officer is found not guilty of using unreasonable force while removing three girls and a woman from a scuffle at a shopping centre.

item.title: The climate conversation is stuck in a loop, but out in the world things are changing
item.description: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

item.title: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer
item.description: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

item.title: Actress Joan Marion never returned to Tasmania, but 'her heart was always in Launceston'
item.description: Tasmania's Joan Marion became a star of the screen and stage abroad; her granddaughter says she maintained a connection to Launceston for much of her life.

item.title: Gout Gout misses out on 200m final at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Rabbits cause 'devastating' damage to Junee cemetery in southern NSW
item.description: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

item.title: China urges Papua New Guinea not to exclude other countries after it signed 'Pukpuk' communique with Australia
item.description: China has urged Papua New Guinea not to sign any deal that might exclude or restrict third parties from cooperating with the Pacific nation, as Australia scrambles to clinch a landmark defence treaty.

item.title: Pat Cummins hints at Ashes strategy amid recovery from back injury with 'starting aim' of playing in all five Tests
item.description: As the men's Ashes approaches, the Australian captain reveals his hopes for taking part in the five-Test series against England as he steps up his injury recovery.

item.title: Report scathing of police and CCC over failure to respond to complaints of police misconduct
item.description: WA Police and the CCC are put on notice after failing to adequately respond to complaints of serious police misconduct, including an allegation an off-duty officer choked a man following a road rage incident.

item.title: What we know about the Optus outage which disrupted triple-zero calls, linked to three deaths
item.description: It's been two days since three people died after a devastating Optus outage caused hundreds of emergency calls to fail, but information about the incident remains scarce.

item.title: Senator calls for 'heads on spikes' to deter superannuation mismanagement
item.description: As questions mount about how Australia's retirement funds industry is regulated, a senator says regulator ASIC must more quickly and forcefully enforce the law.

item.title: Collingwood and Brisbane meet again, two years on from classic 2023 grand final, for tantalising rematch
item.description: The 2023 grand final will go down as one of the best deciders in AFL history, and though the stakes are only marginally lower two years on, the numbers suggest Collingwood and Brisbane's 2025 preliminary final could be another classic.

item.title: Federal government's agriculture emissions reductions 'ambitious' but 'achievable'
item.description: A professor of carbon farming says the agriculture industry will "naturally" contribute to a 28 per cent emissions reduction projected by 2050, but is unlikely to hit its own net-zero targets.

item.title: Remote NSW council holds election after 12 years in administration
item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: Chelsea FC Women's star Sam Kerr presented with special football to mark 100 goals for club
item.description: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

item.title: Victor Caulfield moved to Florence in his 70s and became an artists' model
item.description: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

item.title: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner - ABC News
item.description: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

item.title: Eucalypt trail named after botanist Dean Nicolle opens in SA
item.description: A unique partnership between an artist and a botanist has resulted in an old rail corridor in South Australia becoming an eucalypt forest.

item.title: 'America is not happy': ABC under fire for pulling Jimmy Kimmel Live!
item.description: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

item.title: Near-blinded police officer reunites with those who saved him after rural motorcycle crash
item.description: Police officer John Kenworthy returns to thank the first responders in Mackay, and others who were with him in his darkest moments, after a rural motorcycle crash.

item.title: World-first turtle tracking reveals secrets of flatback turtles in WA's Roebuck Bay
item.description: GPS tracking, motion sensors and video cameras reveal where flatback turtles in Broome's Roebuck Bay feed and travel, contributing to a richer understanding of the vulnerable species.

item.title: UN says there's evidence organised crime scam centres are moving from South-East Asia into new frontier of the Pacific
item.description: As scam centres run by organised crime find it harder to operate in South-East Asia, evidence emerges of them moving into the Pacific and setting up lucrative operations estimated to net billions each year.

item.title: Transition from sheep to cropping in WA's Avon Valley leaving limited balloon landing sites
item.description: The move out of sheep by an increasing number of WA farmers is having an unexpected impact on the state's hot air balloon pilots.

item.title: From Jennifer Lopez to K-pop, meet the Australian backing artists helping superstars shine
item.description: Backup dancers and backing singers spend years perfecting their craft. But who are these artists and how does it feel performing in the shadows of superstars?

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.title: Sharks and Knights reach NRLW preliminary finals
item.description: Cronulla keeps its season alive by defeating North Queensland, as Newcastle advances to a fourth NRLW preliminary final.

item.title: NRL finals updates: Cronulla Sharks defeat Canberra Raiders 32-12 in semifinal
item.description: An out-of-place nose doesn't hurt Joe Tapine as much as Canberra's NRL finals exit, but he hopes the pain of defeat will drive them to greater things next year.

item.title: What is 'Solastalgia' and how are climate-affected communities tackling it?
item.description: If you're overwhelmed by emissions targets, climate change and environmental collapse, start small and look to First Nations practices to help your wellbeing and the world around you.

item.title: Pirate attacks and sea robberies surge in key South-East Asian shipping lane
item.description: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

item.title: Hard Quiz: So you think you're a trivia guru? Go on, prove it!
item.description: I like your trivia enthusiasm, but be careful — you're about to taste defeat.

item.title: Street artist Rone's new 90-metre mural a visual love letter to Geelong
item.description: The faces of 14 people will be immortalised in an enormous mural on the side of a new building in Geelong by locally born, globally renowned artist Rone.

item.title: How skateboarding became a family affair for Townsville single dad Jay MacAskill
item.description: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Can recognising the state of Palestine achieve a two-state solution as Israel continues bombing Gaza?
item.description: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.

item.title: The government says its 2035 climate targets are achievable but mathematics suggests a different story
item.description: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

item.title: Sarah Kopp's teacher Paul Grealy groomed her at 15. As an adult, she held him to account
item.description: Sarah Kopp's life was up-ended when a charismatic teacher twice her age started grooming her. Then they married and had children. When she sought justice 20 years on, she faced an impossible choice.

item.title: Storm-damaged turbine at NSW Central West wind farm raises safety concerns
item.description: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW National Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

item.title: Protesters in Philippines clash with police in rallies against corruption
item.description: Thousands of Filipinos marched in the capital to vent their anger over a ballooning scandal involving bogus flood-control projects believed to have cost taxpayers billions of dollars.

item.title: World leaders are meeting at the UN General Assembly this week. Here are four things to watch for
item.description: World leaders are arriving in New York for the UN General Assembly — and for the first time, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among them.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage investigation underway as minister warns of 'consequences'
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority begins its investigation into the Optus triple-0 outage that has been linked to multiple deaths in South Australia and Western Australia.

item.title: 'Turning it up to eleven': Spinal Tap returns
item.description: The new film follows the fictional heavy metal band reuniting for one final gig with cameos from Elton John and Paul McCartney.

item.title: Is AI impacting your career or life plans? Has its rapid rise got you rethinking your future? The ABC wants to hear from you
item.description: Whether you’re a student halfway through a degree or a mid-career manager planning the next five years, artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping lives across the country. If you've been feeling its effects, the ABC wants to hear from you.

item.description: Almost a decade after being co-founded by the Melbourne Storm and University of the Sunshine Coast, Super Netball's Lightning is entering a new era.

item.description: Scientists have achieved a breakthrough in their work to save the Littlejohn's tree frog species which only exists in three isolated regions in New South Wales.

item.description: Just after the fashion from this evening's Brownlow Medal? We've got you.

item.description: WA’s education minister rejects claims a record number of teachers quitting their jobs is due to them being overworked.

item.title: Ley writes to Republicans vowing to revoke Palestine recognition ahead of Albanese's UN address
item.description: In an unorthodox move, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley writes to a group of Republicans reassuring the Coalition would withdraw recognition of Palestine, ahead of a major United Nations address to be delivered by the prime minister.

item.title: Myanmar junta revoking citizenship of actors, singers and other celebrities
item.description: Myanmar's military junta is using citizenship as a weapon, targeting political opponents, activists and even celebrities who speak out against the regime.

item.description: Community members who showed up for the meeting on the Inner West Council's Fairer Future Plan were turned away at the door after being told the venue was full.

item.title: Doctors concerned easily accessible illegal cigarettes are causing smoking rates to increase
item.description: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

item.title: Byron Bay's 60-day holiday rental cap yields mixed results in first year
item.description: A year after controversial holiday rental caps were introduced in Byron Bay to boost rental availability, the data is unclear about whether the endeavour has been a success.

item.title: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera being robbed overshadowed Matt Rowell's Brownlow Medal win, and could change the voting process forever
item.description: It is not often that the AFL's night of nights gets hijacked by a moment not involving the winner of the Brownlow Medal. This is exactly what took place when Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera was seemingly robbed in broad daylight.

item.title: Experts say paracetamol safe for pregnancy, no proof for autism link made by Donald Trump
item.description: Australia's medicines regulator says paracetamol remains safe to use during pregnancy despite Donald Trump's administration linking its use to an increased risk of autism.

item.title: Deeming rates have increased after a five-year freeze. Here's how that could impact pension payments
item.description: The changes impact people on Centrelink payments who earn an income from financial assets, but pensioners are the biggest group to be affected.

item.title: As a doctor I'm choosing self-care over resilience
item.description: As a doctor who advocates for self-care, it took me a surprisingly long time to look after myself. Now I'm trying to be a good example for my patients and other doctors.

item.title: Alice Springs Mayor Asta Hill tells of family tragedy that brought her back to home town
item.description: Asta Hill's grief over the tragic death of her younger brother 10 years ago is still raw, but the sad event is part of her story of connection to Alice Springs and hope for the outback town.

item.title: Vanuatu plans to sign police deal with China while Nakamal pact with Australia is left hanging
item.description: Vanuatu declares it will sign a new policing agreement with China as the landmark Nakamal pact between Australia and the Pacific Island nation hangs in the balance.

item.description: The first sign something was wrong came late on Friday afternoon. Now we have a clearer picture of how the triple-0 outage unfolded.

item.description: The Trump administration's rhetoric only adds to the noise around autism and will make it harder for the community to feel understood and accepted.

item.title: Andrew Hastie's spray at 'muppet', 'coward' Liberal colleagues after post bemoaning loss of Aussie car making

item.description: The federal government has yet to pass legislation to empower a new coordinator for the emergency services line, but experts say tougher conditions are needed on the telco itself.

item.description: One of international cricket's most recognised umpires is being remembered for his "fairness, humour and love of the game".

item.description: England will bring a strong pace bowling attack, but several members of the squad, including captain Ben Stokes, are under injury clouds.

item.description: Perth Observatory says it has received reports of lights dancing in the sky across a significant part of WA's Midwest and Goldfields, with an explanation yet to be found.

item.description: Australia's famed sculpture walk is facing cancellation after failing to secure funding less than a month out from this year's event.

item.description: For newly-announced Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon, Wednesday morning would have been both one of his proudest moments, and his most uncomfortable.

item.description: From a unique tattoo to a personalised burger, the AFL grand final is more than just a game for these super fans.

item.description: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

item.title: Independent review launched into fire ant eradication program amid 'closing window of opportunity'
item.description: Authorities launch an independent review of Australia's national fire ant eradication program to evaluate the country's fight against one of the world’s most destructive pests.

item.title: Families demand inquiry into NSW Police handling of missing persons cases
item.description: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

item.title: Solar, batteries and the 'phone charger dilemma': How a standards gap threatens clean tech
item.description: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

item.title: Family calls for change amid frustration at seven-year coronial inquest wait
item.description: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

item.title: Elevated E. coli levels recorded at major NT crocodile farm owned by luxury label Hermès
item.description: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

item.title: Alexa Leary and Callum Simpson win gold medals for Australia at World Para Swimming Championships in Singapore
item.description: Alexa Leary's win in the final individual event of Wednesday night's action in Singapore bookended a golden night for Australia after Callum Simpson won gold in the first event of the evening.

item.title: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania from Maydena to Hobart
item.description: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

item.title: 'On guard' for share market correction, Optus debacle began in India — as it happened
item.description: Optus has now told the ABC the firewall upgrade that led to disrupted triple-0 calls was initiated in Chennai, India. Meanwhile veteran stockbroker Marcus Padley says he's "on guard" for a share market wipe-out.

item.title: Who is Samoa's new prime minister, Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt?
item.description: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt, question his motives.

item.title: Hundreds of new dust-related lung disease cases recorded in Queensland
item.description: Nearly 300 workers from mines and work sites have had cases of lung cancer, black lung and other illnesses recorded by the state's dust disease register in the space of 12 months.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns UN of 'the most destructive arms race in human history'
item.description: Ukraine's president calls for global action to regulate the twin threats posed by drone technology and artificial intelligence, warning "no-one can feel safe" from Russia's expansionist goals.

item.title: AFL grand final sprint won't feature all teams, as Gout Gout and Harry Garside to feature at the MCG
item.description: The AFL announces that only seven AFL players will run in the traditional grand final sprint, with Olympic boxer Harry Garside also joining in.

item.title: Macquarie to repay Shield investors after super platform failures
item.description: Macquarie commits to repaying thousands of Australians who invested hundreds of millions of their retirement savings in the collapsed Shield Master Fund amid admissions it contravened the Corporations Act.

item.title: China's President Xi Jinping announces new climate goal to cut emissions by 2035
item.description: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

item.title: ARIA Award nominations 2025: Ninajirachi, Dom Dolla, Amyl & The Sniffers lead the pack
item.description: All the contenders are hopefuls vying for ARIA Awards glory at the music industry's glitzy ceremony, taking place next month.

item.title: Peter Tonagh to replace Catherine West as Nine's chair
item.description: He replaces Catherine West, who spent 18 months in the position.

item.title: Massive sinkhole disrupts traffic and power supply in central Bangkok
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dramatic footage shows sinkhole swallowing up road in central Bangkok
item.description: Social media footage shows powerlines being pulled down into the 50-metre deep hole and vehicles teetering on the edge.

item.title: Growing AFL fan club for people with disability helps forge friendships
item.description: A growing club on the border between Victoria and New South Wales helps AFL fans with disabilities connect with friends who share their love for the sport.

item.title: Andrea James to lead Ilbijerri Theatre Company as artistic director Rachael Maza steps back
item.description: Andrea James will take the helm of Australia's oldest Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri, as outgoing artistic director Rachael Maza steps back after almost 18 years.

item.title: NT para athlete Briseis Brittain wasn't born when Cathy Freeman won Olympic gold, but the moment fired a dream
item.description: Arnhem Land teenager Briseis Brittain is set to represent Australia at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi this month, competing in the 200m and 400m races.

item.title: Anthony Albanese addresses UN on climate goals, Gaza and Australia's security council bid
item.description: The prime minister uses his UN speech to talk up Australia's emissions plan after Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", and confirms Australia is still seeking a temporary seat on the body's security council.

item.title: Figure skating star scraps program amid probe involving artist who co-wrote music
item.description: Figure skaters spend months perfecting their programs ahead of big competitions, but now world champion Alysa Liu has to come up with a new short program months out from the Winter Olympics as her existing music involves an American artist under investigation.

item.title: Scott Selwood takes break from AFL after 'personally challenging year'
item.description: Scott Selwood will take time away from football, stepping down as an assistant coach with Collingwood, following a year marked by personal tragedy.

item.title: AI image recognition technology used to detect traffic offences raises privacy concerns, Queensland audit finds
item.description: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

item.title: Breastfeeding in public is protected in Australia. So why are mothers still facing discrimination?
item.description: Last week a breastfeeding mother was asked to leave a Virgin Australia lounge for pumping. Experts says while there is a level of awareness that breastfeeding in public is protected, some people in the community still view it as "inappropriate".

item.title: What are Australia's chances of returning to the UN Security Council?
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes a fresh push for Australia to get a seat on the United Nations Security Council in 2029-30.

item.title: Snoop Dogg says AFL grand final is 'a way of life' ahead of headline show
item.description: Snoop Dogg has strutted into the MCG for his official appearance ahead of a fascinating, somewhat controversial, AFL grand-final entertainment set.

item.title: Denmark PM apologises to indigenous Greenlanders who faced forced contraception
item.description: The apology by Mette Frederiksen in Greenland’s capital, Nuuk, hopes to close a traumatic chapter in Greenland's history.

item.title: Forestry industry says it can meet demand for biofuels as climate targets near
item.description: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

item.title: Perth grandmother Donna Nelson loses appeal over Japan drug smuggling conviction
item.description: Convicted drug smuggler and Perth grandmother, Donna Nelson, loses her appeal against her conviction for smuggling two kilograms of methamphetamine into Tokyo Airport.

item.title: Trio of space weather satellites launched to study the Sun's violent side
item.description: NASA successfully launches multiple satellites designed to get a better understanding of the Sun's influence on Earth.

item.title: TGA approves new brain stimulation device for treatment of depression
item.description: Some international users of Flow Neuroscience's device have labelled the wearable tech as a game-changer in treating depression, but not everyone is convinced.

item.title: Key takeaways from day two at the UN General Assembly's world leaders week
item.description: The world's most powerful people are meeting in New York this week. Here are the key takeaways from the UN summit's second day.

item.title: Wallabies vs All Blacks Bledisloe Cup: Team lists, what time is kick-off? How can I watch?
item.description: Wallabies prop James Slipper will notch an important milestone against New Zealand on Saturday, while James O'Connor will start at fly half.

item.title: Striking a Chord | Astrid Jorgensen
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: South Australia passes laws to protect victims of personal injury from 'claim farmers'
item.description: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

item.title: Hastie lets loose, one-on-one with Albanese and Trump, and the politics of Palestinian recognition
item.description: It turns out that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese didn't need a can of Diet Coke and a cheeseburger to attracted the US president's attention.

item.title: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright set to appeal guilty verdict on five grounds
item.description: Matt Wright’s lawyers have confirmed they will file a notice of appeal within the next 48 hours, indicating it will be based on five different grounds.

item.title: Ahead of the biggest game of his NRL career, Nicho Hynes returns to where it all began
item.description: Ten years to the day since his first moment in the spotlight, Nicho Hynes returns to AAMI Park for the most important game of his NRL career.

item.title: Firefighters race to set hazard reduction burns across Greater Sydney ahead of fire season
item.description: Sydney's wettest August on record has dampened efforts by fire authorities to meet hazard reduction burn targets.

item.title: Liberal veteran Amanda Vanstone chides Andrew Hastie for not being a team player, warns of runaway ego
item.description: A doyenne of the Liberal Party and veteran of leadership battles dating back to the 1980s Howard-Peacock era has chided Andrew Hastie for not being a team player.

item.title: Matildas strike force could benefit from having both Sam Kerr and Michelle Heyman firing fit up front
item.description: A fit-again Sam Kerr doesn't necessarily spell the end for Michelle Heyman's time in the Matildas, if anything the A-League star can't wait for her return.

item.title: Lachie Neale and Rhys Stanley named in AFL grand final teams as Jarrod Berry fails to recover from shoulder injury
item.description: Brisbane's co-captain returns just weeks after doctors gave him as little as a five per cent chance of featuring in his third straight grand final as Geelong welcomes back a familiar face to take the place of Tom Stewart.

item.title: Adelaide 36ers terminate Montrezl Harrell's contract amid China doping case
item.description: The Adelaide 36ers terminate Montrezl Harrell's contract while he serves a provisional ban after testing positive for an illicit substance.

item.title: Albury Wodonga Health surgeon claims he was sacked for criticising development plans
item.description: An Albury Wodonga surgeon says the local health service dismissed him after he spoke out against a major redevelopment of the hospital and changes to the region's cancer centre.

item.title: Measles case detected in Brisbane, prompting calls for vaccination
item.description: Queensland's health department says the person was believed to have contracted the virus in Bali, before visiting a number of businesses across Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast.

item.title: Lawyers for Raiders star Josh Papalii ask court to permanently stay charges over police group chat
item.description: The Raiders star's lawyers are asking the ACT Magistrates Court to permanently stay charges against him over a 2024 incident.

item.title: Horse trainer Dwayne Schmidt jailed for raping and impregnating 13yo girl
item.description: New South Wales horse trainer Dwayne Schmidt is sentenced to more than three years in jail for raping and impregnating a 13-year-old girl.

item.title: Gympie Regional Council votes to remove fluoride from town's water supply
item.description: Gympie scraps fluoride from its water supply and becomes the third region in Queensland to reject the practice in just over a year.

item.title: Coroner finds Monash Health provided unreasonable care before toddler Dio Kemp's death
item.description: Three-year-old Dio Kemp was taken to Monash Medical Centre four times over 10 days before she died of sepsis.

item.title: Mass puffer fish deaths and red-bell jellyfish bloom put Pilbara coast on alert
item.description: Hundreds of dead puffer fish are found on a Pilbara beach, as an epic red-bell jellyfish bloom prompts a warning from the region's ports authority.

item.title: Arts industry leaders call for tax reforms to help struggling sector
item.description: Arts industry leaders say creative tax form is needed to create greater opportunities for Australian artists.

item.title: All the latest finance news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Denmark's defence minister says 'professional actor' behind drone flights over airports
item.description: The drone flights occurred over several airports across the country throughout the week.

item.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy found guilty of criminal conspiracy in case linked to Muammar Gaddafi
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy is found guilty of obtaining millions of euros in illegal financing from late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi for his successful 2007 presidential bid.

item.title: Jerry Robertson found guilty of murdering partner with sledgehammer in Alice Springs
item.description: An NT Supreme Court jury finds an Alice Springs man guilty of murdering his female partner in July 2023.

item.title: Fourth NZYQ member issued Nauruan visa as Labor steams ahead with deportation plan
item.description: The former detainee was returned to immigration detention on Thursday and could be the first person transferred under the multi-billion-dollar deal inked with Nauru earlier this month.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks to appeal to prostitution conviction
item.description: The former hip-hop mogul was found guilty by a jury on prostitution charges but cleared him of the more serious counts of sex trafficking and racketeering.

item.title: Amazon fined $3.8bn for misleading American Prime subscribers
item.description: Around 35 million Prime customers, equivalent to one in 10 American citizens, will be eligible for a payout.

item.title: Out-of-pocket costs, eroding trust contributing to decline in childhood vaccination rates, new report finds
item.description: A new report finds out-of-pocket costs and eroding trust are contributing to a "concerning" decline in childhood vaccination rates.

item.title: GIM Trading used virtual office space to create veneer of legitimacy as it allegedly defrauded millions
item.description: GIM Trading has been accused of defrauding Aussie investors out of millions of dollars. Financial investigators say the company created a veneer of legitimacy and evidence suggested overseas criminals could be involved.

item.title: China aid and investment returns to Solomon Islands's Malaita province after ban
item.description: The Solomon Islands's province of Malaita made global headlines five years ago when it banned Chinese investment. But today, a new China-funded road project is on the way — and the people are all for it.

item.title: Traditional owners slam state premiers for 'disgraceful' call to push ahead with Santos gas project
item.description: The debate over Santos's Narrabri gas project reignites, with traditional owners condemning 'disgraceful' comments made by two state premiers.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A viral Donald Trump moment, a retracted study and daylight saving time
item.description: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

item.title: Teachers and students affected by anti-Palestinian racism, report into schools shows
item.description: The Australia Palestine Advocacy Network releases its first national register report to examine "the climate of fear, censorship, intimidation and punishment" experienced by students, teachers and members of the school community.

item.title: Imported potatoes threaten Tasmanian growers, as companies look for cost savings overseas
item.description: Cheap potato imports from India and China are threatening the livelihoods of Tasmanian growers, as stalled negotiations with potato giant Simplot leave some farmers about to plant this year's crop without a contract.
